notes.text:
An update for the go-toolset:rhel8 module is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Go Toolset provides the Go programming language tools and libraries. Go is alternatively known as golang. 

Security Fix(es):

* golang: net/http/internal: Denial of Service (DoS) via Resource Consumption via HTTP requests (CVE-2023-39326)

* golang: cmd/go: Protocol Fallback when fetching modules (CVE-2023-45285)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Golang net/http/internal package. This issue may allow a malicious user to send an HTTP request and cause the receiver to read more bytes from network than are in the body (up to 1GiB), causing the receiver to fail reading the response, possibly leading to a Denial of Service (DoS).
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http/internal: Denial of Service (DoS) via Resource Consumption via HTTP requests
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
No mitigation is available for this flaw.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/http/internal: Denial of Service (DoS) via Resource Consumption via HTTP requests

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Golang package cmd/go. This issue permits the fallback to insecure "git://" if trying to fetch a .git module that has no "https://" or "git+ssh://" available.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: cmd/go: Protocol Fallback when fetching modules
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat rates this issue as Moderate, as the default configuration avoids this behavior, mitigating the vulnerability.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

This issue only affects users who are not using the module proxy and are fetching modules directly (i.e. GOPROXY=off). In order to mitigate this, keep GOPROXY with default values and use a module proxy. This vulnerability is not explored with default GOPROXY value.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: cmd/go: Protocol Fallback when fetching modules
